translation_text.mn12:57.3: But it’s not easy to find a realm that I haven’t previously transmigrated to in all this long time, except for the gods of the pure abodes.
translation_text.mn12:57.4: For if I had transmigrated to the gods of the pure abodes I would not have returned to this realm again.
translation_text.mn12:58.1: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
translation_text.mn12:58.3: But it’s not easy to find any rebirth that I haven’t previously been reborn in …

translation_text.mn12:59.3: But it’s not easy to find an abode where I haven’t previously abided …
translation_text.mn12:60.1: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
translation_text.mn12:60.3: But it’s not easy to find a sacrifice that I haven’t previously offered in all this long time, when I was an anointed aristocratic king or a well-to-do brahmin.
translation_text.mn12:61.1: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
translation_text.mn12:61.2: ‘Purity comes from serving the sacred flame.’
translation_text.mn12:61.3: But it’s not easy to find a fire that I haven’t previously served in all this long time, when I was an anointed aristocratic king or a well-to-do brahmin.
translation_text.mn12:62.1: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
translation_text.mn12:62.2: ‘So long as this gentleman is youthful, young, with pristine black hair, blessed with youth, in the prime of life he will be endowed with perfect lucidity of wisdom.
translation_text.mn12:62.3: But when he’s old, elderly, and senior, advanced in years, and has reached the final stage of life—eighty, ninety, or a hundred years old—he will lose his lucidity of wisdom.’
translation_text.mn12:62.4: But you should not see it like this.
translation_text.mn12:62.5: For now I am old, elderly, and senior, I’m advanced in years, and have reached the final stage of life. I am eighty years old.
translation_text.mn12:62.6: Suppose I had four disciples with a lifespan of a hundred years. And they each were perfect in memory, range, retention, and perfect lucidity of wisdom.
translation_text.mn12:62.7: Imagine how easily a well-trained expert archer with a strong bow would shoot a light arrow across the shadow of a palm tree.
translation_text.mn12:62.8: That’s how extraordinary they were in memory, range, retention, and perfect lucidity of wisdom.
translation_text.mn12:62.9: They’d bring up questions about the four kinds of mindfulness meditation again and again, and I would answer each question. They’d remember the answers and not ask the same question twice.
translation_text.mn12:62.10: And they’d pause only to eat and drink, go to the toilet, and sleep to dispel weariness. But the Realized One would not run out of Dhamma teachings, words and phrases of the teachings, or spontaneous answers.
translation_text.mn12:62.11: And at the end of a hundred years my four disciples would pass away.
translation_text.mn12:62.12: Even if you have to carry me around on a stretcher, there will never be any deterioration in the Realized One’s lucidity of wisdom.
translation_text.mn12:63.1: And if there’s anyone of whom it may be rightly said that
translation_text.mn12:63.2: a being not liable to delusion has arisen in the world for the welfare and happiness of the people, out of sympathy for the world, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans, it’s of me that this should be said.”
translation_text.mn12:64.1: Now at that time Venerable Nāgasamāla was standing behind the Buddha fanning him.
translation_text.mn12:64.2: Then he said to the Buddha:
translation_text.mn12:64.4: While I was listening to this exposition of the teaching my hair stood up!
translation_text.mn12:64.5: What is the name of this exposition of the teaching?”
translation_text.mn12:64.6: “Well then, Nāgasamāla, you may remember this exposition of the teaching as ‘The Hair-raising Discourse’.”
translation_text.mn12:64.7: That is what the Buddha said.
translation_text.mn12:64.8: Satisfied, Venerable Nāgasamāla approved what the Buddha said.
